intro: Hieracium albipedunculatum, commonly known as the white-stemmed hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and bright yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often covered with fine hairs. Hieracium albipedunculatum is known for its ability to thrive in disturbed soils and is often found in meadows and along roadsides.
